title: Publish Your Streamlit Apps in the Cloud
description: Share your Streamlit apps with these free tools: Streamlit Cloud, Github and VSCode

title: Data Scientists: Write your Medium Articles in Jupyter
description: Don’t waste time cutting and pasting and making screen shots of data tables, write everything as a Jupyter Notebook and upload to Medium

title: Create a Web App from Your Jupyter Notebook with Mercury
description: You can published you Notebook as an interactive web app with or without the code

title: How Not to Lie with Charts
description: You can use data visualization to inform, or misinform. We look at the things to avoid if you want to do the former and not the latter.

title: Interactive Data Visualization with Julia and Pluto Notebooks
description: Pluto is an important development that allows you to easily interact with your data. We take a quick look at it using the Julia plotting package to easily create impressive graphs.

title: How to Build a Gallery of Streamlit Apps as a Single Web App
description: Download a free template, pop in multiple Streamlit apps and you’ve got a multiple Streamlit apps on a single web page

title: An Interactive Web Dashboard with Plotly and Flask
description: To create a truly interactive app with Dash you need to use callbacks. You can achieve the same thing with Plotly and Flask.

title: Why I’m Using VSCode for Jupyter Notebooks
description: VSCode is a great Python editor and, as I accidentally discovered, good for Jupyter Notebooks, too

title: Topical Plots: Global Warming Heatmaps
description: Which chart will get the message across best

title: Plotting with Pandas: An Introduction to Data Visualization
description: If you are a budding Data Scientist or Data Journalist, being able to visualize your data gives you the ability to better understand it

title: ggplot: Grammar of Graphics in Python with Plotnine
description:
Do you wish that Python could emulate the superb visualizations that ggplot gives you in the R language? Well it can.
Plotnine is a powerful graphics library for great visualizations and based on ggplot

title: Data Visualization with Julia and VSCode
description: With Julia and the free VSCode IDE, you can make impressive data visualizations with little programming knowledge.
